title: Worked Solution
text:
To calculate the wavelength of the gamma rays emitted by $$^{60}Co$$, we can use the formula that relates the speed of light ($$c$$), frequency ($$f$$), and wavelength ($$\lambda$$): 
 $$\lambda =  rac{c}{f}$$ 
 Where:
- $$c$$ is the speed of light in a vacuum, approximately $$3.00 	imes 10^8 m/s$$,
- $$f$$ is the frequency of the radiation, given as $$2.83 	imes 10^{20}s^{-1}$$.
Let's calculate the wavelength: $$\lambda =  rac{3.00 	imes 10^8 m/s}{2.83 	imes 10^{20} s^{-1}} = 1.06 	imes 10^{-12} m$$ 
 Now, to convert meters to nanometers (nm), we use the fact that $$1 m = 10^9 nm$$: 
 $$\lambda = 1.06 	imes 10^{-12} m 	imes 10^9 nm/m = 1.06 	imes 10^{-3} nm$$
Thus, the wavelength of the gamma rays is $$1.06 	imes 10^{-3} nm$$.
